verses.text: 安息日的主安息日那天，耶穌從麥田經過；他的門徒餓了，就摘了些麥穗來吃。

words.note: Lit. 'peace rest day'.
Lit. 'peace rest day'.
Lit. 'gate follower'; disciple, student.

verses.text: 法利賽人看見了，就對他說：「你看，你的門徒作了安息日不可作的事。」

words.note: A Jewish religious-political party in ancient Judea.
Lit. 'gate follower'; disciple, student.
Lit. 'peace rest day'.
Often combined with 以 to mean 'can/may'.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「大衛和跟他在一起的人，在飢餓的時候所作的，你們沒有念過嗎？

words.note: Indicates the following verb is the object of a previous action or agency (所V的 = 'that which is V-ed').

verses.text: 他不是進了 神的殿，吃了他和跟他在一起的人不可以吃，只有祭司才可以吃的陳設餅嗎？

words.note: A blank space used in some Chinese Bibles to show reverence for God.
Used as a proper noun for God in the Bible.
Refers to the Jewish Temple.
Often combined with 以 to mean 'can/may'.
Consecrated bread placed in the Tabernacle/Temple, only for priests.

verses.text: 律法書上記著：安息日，祭司在殿裡供職，觸犯了安息日，也不算有罪；你們也沒有念過嗎？

words.note: Refers to the Pentateuch or Mosaic Law.
Lit. 'peace rest day'.
Refers to the Jewish Temple.
Often used as a locative suffix (e.g., 這裡).
Formal term for holding an office or performing duties.
Lit. 'peace rest day'.

verses.text: 我告訴你們，這裡有一位是比聖殿更大的。

words.note: Lit. 'holy hall'

verses.text: 如果你們明白『我喜愛憐憫，不喜愛祭祀』這句話的意思，就不會把無罪的定罪了。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
Turns adjective into a noun phrase (e.g., 'the innocent ones').
Lit. 'determine guilt'.

verses.text: 因為人子是安息日的主。」

words.note: A title Jesus often used for himself.
Lit. 'rest day'. Refers to the seventh day of the week, a holy day.

verses.text: 治好手枯的人耶穌離開那裡，來到他們的會堂。

words.note: Describes the condition of a hand.

verses.text: 會堂裡有一個人，他的一隻手枯乾了。有人問耶穌：「在安息日治病，可以嗎？」目的是要控告耶穌。

breakdown.m: measure word for certain body parts

words.note: Here implies 'there were some people'.
Verb-object compound, 'treat disease'.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「你們當中有哪一個，他僅有的一隻羊在安息日跌進坑裡，會不把羊抓住拉上來呢？

words.note: Used for animals, boats, and some objects.
Lit. 'rest day'.
Auxiliary verb indicating possibility or likelihood.
Marks the object that is acted upon.
Often used for rhetorical questions or suggestions.

verses.text: 人比羊貴重得多了！所以，在安息日行善是可以的。」

words.note: Links a verb/adjective to its complement describing degree/result.
Indicates a new situation or completed action.
Lit. 'rest day'.
A verb-object compound, often used in moral/religious contexts.
Emphasizes the preceding clause as a statement.

verses.text: 於是對那人說：「伸出手來！」他把手一伸，就復原了，好像另一隻手一樣。

words.note: Connects clauses, indicating a consequence.
Indicates movement towards the speaker/subject.
Marks the object that is acted upon.
Used with a verb to indicate immediate action.
Indicates a quick succession or consequence.
Indicates a new situation or completed action.
Used for animals, boats, some objects, and body parts like hands/feet.

verses.text: 法利賽人出去，商議怎樣對付耶穌，好殺掉他。

words.note: Transliteration of 'Pharisee' with 'person/people' suffix.

breakdown.m: to pay, hand over, deal with

words.note: Functions as a conjunction introducing a purpose clause.

verses.text: 神揀選的僕人耶穌知道了，就離開那裡。有很多人跟隨他，他醫好他們所有的病人，

words.note: Used to refer to the Judeo-Christian God.
Often used in religious contexts for divine choosing.
Often refers to 'servant of God' in biblical context.
Indicates the completion of an action.
Indicates a logical consequence or immediate action.

verses.text: 又囑咐他們不可替他張揚。

words.note: Combines 'not' and 'can' to mean 'must not'.
Lit. 'spread and raise', implying to make widely known.

verses.text: 這就應驗了以賽亞先知所說的：

words.note: Often used in biblical prophecy fulfillment.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Forms a nominalizer like 'that which is...'
Completes the nominalized phrase 'what was said'.

verses.text: 「看哪！我所揀選的僕人，我所愛，心裡所喜悅的；我要把我的靈賜給他，他必向萬國宣揚公理。

words.note: An exclamation to draw attention.
Often refers to a servant of God in biblical context.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
Refers to the Holy Spirit or God's spirit.

verses.text: 他不爭吵，也不喧嚷，人在街上聽不見他的聲音。

words.note: A potential complement 'cannot perceive by hearing'.

verses.text: 壓傷的蘆葦，他不折斷，將殘的燈火，他不吹滅；直到他施行公理，使公理得勝。

words.note: Often used for a dying flame or lamp.
Lit. 'obtain victory'.

verses.text: 萬民都要寄望於他的名。」

words.note: Refers to all nations/ethnic groups, especially in biblical prophecy.
A more formal way of expressing hope or expectation.
Classical Chinese preposition, common in religious texts.
In biblical context, 'name' often implies character, authority, or presence.

verses.text: 耶穌靠 神的靈趕鬼有人帶了一個被鬼附著、又瞎又啞的人到耶穌那裡。耶穌醫好了他，那啞巴就能說話，也能看見了。

words.definition: to rely on, by means of

words.note: Often preceded by a space or raised dot in Chinese Bibles to denote reverence.
Refers to the Holy Spirit in this context.

verses.text: 群眾都很驚奇，說：「難道他就是大衛的子孫？」

words.note: Used to express rhetorical questions, implying disbelief or surprise.

verses.text: 法利賽人聽見了，說：「這個人趕鬼，只不過是靠鬼王別西卜罷了。」

words.note: A Jewish religious and political party in ancient Israel.

words.definition: to rely on, by means of

words.note: Refers to Satan or a chief demon.

verses.text: 耶穌知道他們的心思，就對他們說：「如果一個國家自相紛爭，就必定荒涼；一城一家自相紛爭，必站立不住。

words.note: A formal way to express internal conflict or mutual action.
Can describe a physical place or a state of ruin.
A formal way to express internal conflict or mutual action.

words.definition: cannot stand, unable to stand firm
words.note: Describes inability to remain stable or endure.

verses.text: 如果撒但趕逐撒但，就會自相紛爭。那麼，他的國怎能站立得住呢？

words.note: Often refers to God's Kingdom in biblical context.
Verb complement indicating stability.

verses.text: 我若靠別西卜趕鬼，你們的子孫又靠誰呢？這樣，他們就要斷定你們的不是。
我若靠 神的靈趕鬼， 神的國就已經臨到你們了。

words.note: Often preceded by a full-width space for reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to Holy Spirit in Christian context.
Often preceded by a full-width space for reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Refers to God's Kingdom in biblical context.

verses.text: 如果不先把壯漢綁起來，怎能進到他的家裡，搶奪財物呢？如果綁起來了，就可以搶劫他的家了。
不站在我這一邊的就是反對我的，不跟我一起收聚的，就是分散的。

words.note: Here used to nominalize the preceding phrase.
Here used to nominalize the preceding phrase.
Here used to nominalize the preceding phrase.
Here used to nominalize the preceding phrase.

verses.text: 因此，我告訴你們，人的一切罪和褻瀆的話，都可以赦免；可是，褻瀆聖靈就得不著赦免。

words.note: Refers to the divine Holy Spirit.

verses.text: 無論誰說話得罪了人子，還可以赦免；但說話得罪了聖靈的，今生來世都得不著赦免。

words.note: Lit. 'incur sin/offense'
A title for Jesus.
Refers to the divine Holy Spirit.

verses.text: 種好樹結好果子「你們種好樹就結好果子，種壞樹就結壞果子；憑著果子就能認出樹來。
毒蛇所生的啊，你們既然是邪惡的，怎能說出良善的話？因為心中所充滿的，口裡就說出來。

words.note: Refers to venomous snakes, often used metaphorically for evil people.

verses.text: 良善的人從他良善的心（「心」原文作「庫房」）發出良善，邪惡的人從他邪惡的心（「心」原文作「庫房」）發出邪惡。
我告訴你們，人所說的閒話，在審判的日子，句句都要供出來，

words.note: Often indicates 'that which is done' or 'what is said'.
Repetition emphasizes 'every single one'.

verses.text: 因為你要照你的話被稱為義，或定為有罪。」
約拿的神蹟當時，有一些經學家和法利賽人對耶穌說：「老師，我們想請你顯個神蹟看看。」

words.note: Often a colloquial short form of 一個 (yīgè).
Repetition indicates a casual or tentative action.

verses.text: 但耶穌說：「邪惡和淫亂的世代尋求神蹟，除了約拿先知的神蹟以外，再沒有神蹟給你們了。
約拿怎樣三日三夜在大魚的腹中，人子也要照樣三日三夜在地裡。

words.note: A common idiom in biblical contexts.
A title Jesus used for himself.
A common idiom in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 審判的時候，尼尼微人要和這個世代一同起來，定這個世代的罪，因為他們聽了約拿所傳的就悔改了。你看，這裡有一位是比約拿更大的。

words.note: Used before verbs to form a nominalized phrase, indicating 'that which is V-ed'.
A key concept in Christian theology.

verses.text: 審判的時候，南方的女王要和這個世代一同起來，定這個世代的罪，因為她從地極來到，要聽所羅門智慧的話。你看，這裡有一位是比所羅門更大的。
污靈去而復返的教訓「有一個污靈離開了一個人，走遍乾旱之地，尋找棲身的地方，卻沒有找到。

words.note: More formal/literary than 再 (zài).
More formal/literary than 回 (huí).
Literary equivalent of 的 (de).

verses.text: 他就說：『我要回到我從前離開了的那房子。』到了之後，看見裡面空著，已經打掃乾淨，粉飾好了，
他就去帶了另外七個比自己更惡的污靈來，一齊進去住在那裡；那人後來的情況，比以前更壞了。這邪惡的世代也會這樣。」
誰是耶穌的母親和弟兄耶穌還在對群眾講話的時候，他的母親和弟弟站在外面，要找他講話。

words.note: Refers to brothers generally or fellow believers.
Indicates an action is ongoing.

Connects a descriptive clause to a noun.
Reduplication for endearment or diminutive effect.
A common verb-object compound.

verses.text: 有人告訴耶穌：「你的母親和弟弟站在外面，有話要跟你說。」

words.note: Used with 人 to mean 'someone' or 'there are people'.
Reduplication for endearment or diminutive effect.

verses.text: 他回答那人：「誰是我的母親？誰是我的弟兄？」

words.note: Refers to brothers generally or fellow believers.

verses.text: 他伸手指著門徒說：「你看，我的母親，我的弟兄！

words.note: Indicates continuous or sustained action/state.
Literally 'gate-follower' or 'school-follower'.
Refers to brothers generally or fellow believers.

verses.text: 凡是遵行我天父旨意的，就是我的弟兄、姊妹和母親了。」

words.note: Emphasizes adherence to rules, commands, or will.
